result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew P Denzin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The fine and costs are added to defendant's current payment plan of $50.00 a month beginning October 1, 2015 with payments increasing to $100.00 a month beginning January 1, 2016.

The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Consecutive to: Taylor County Case No. 15CT28

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew P Denzin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Matthew P Denzin
Current: 801 Liberty St., Ripon, WI 54971 United States  (Effective: 03-06-2017)
Prior: W996 Mira Ave, Medford, WI 54451-9554

Defendant Matthew P Denzin in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record for cases 15CT13, 15TR47, 15CT28, 15CM55 and 15CM56.  Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1 in 15CT13; guilty to Case No. 15TR47, guilty to Count 1 in 15CT28, and guilty to Count 1 in 15CM56.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty in each of the cases that defendant pled to.  15TR47 - the court ordered a forfeiture in the amount of $175.30.  15CT13 - the court ordered $100.00 fine plus court costs and DNA surcharge.  15CT28 - the court ordered $1,700.00 fine; 60 days county jail with huber and good time - 39 days sentence credit;  14 month revocation of driver's license; IID; $41.00 blood draw and AODA.  The remaining counts are dismissed and read in.  15CM56 the court ordered court costs and DNA surcharge; 60 days county jail consecutive to 15CT28 with huber and good time - 39 days sentence credit.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.  Case No. 15CM55 is dismissed.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Matthew P Denzin in court with attorney Alec Nocco.  Defendant Matthew P Denzin in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:00 pm.  - rt

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matthew Denzin appeared in court, in custody.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $1,000.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders bond as requested by the district attorney.  Court orders clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in defendant's other two cases.  Next court date is June 16, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
